newsitem.title: USA: Western Wireless to buy Triad assets.
newsitem.headline: Western Wireless to buy Triad assets.

text.p: Western Wireless Corp said on Friday it executed a definitive agreement to buy California-based Triad Cellular Corp's cellular properties and certain related assets.
Triad would receiving $184.8 million in cash and 1.6 million shares of Class A Western Wireless shares, it said.
Western Wireless said it would get 12 rural service area licenses covering about one million people in Texas, Oklahoma, Utah and Minnesota.
Triad is majority-owned by the Boston-based venture capital group Media/Communications Partners, it said.
"The acquisition of these cellular markets enhances our already strong presence in the western United States," Western Wireless Chairman John Stanton said.
Stanton said the cellular properties were contiguous to existing Western Wireless cellular markets and would allow the company to expand coverage areas to wireless subscribers.
"These markets complement our strategy of using cellular technology for rural areas and PCS technology for urban areas," he said.
Consummation of the transaction was subject to regulatory approval and Western Wireless said it expected the deal to close in the fourth quarter.
